unnormalised: IIT Bombay just announced a mandatory remedial course in Diff Eq for all 2nd year engineering students! Sources say a shockingly high 98.7% of students struggled with even basic differentiation during the recent "Calculus Ka Karishma" exam. Exam scores were apparently so low, even the professor, Dr. Iyer (PhD, ISI Kolkata), momentarily forgot how to calculate the 1st derivative of sin(x).
normalised: I-I-T Bombay just announced a mandatory remedial course in Differential Equation for all second year engineering students! Sources say a shockingly high ninety eight point seven percent of students struggled with even basic differentiation during the recent "Calculus Ka Karishma" exam. Exam scores were apparently so low, even the professor, Dr. Iyer (P-h-D, I-S-I Kolkata), momentarily forgot how to calculate the first derivative of sine of x.

unnormalised: Apparently, one particularly ambitious student tried to solve a multi-variable optimization problem using only Bollywood dance moves. While creative, the examiners weren't exactly swayed. Another student allegedly submitted a 50-page essay on the philosophical implications of limits, completely neglecting to actually, you know, *solve* any limits. And someone else tried to use the "jugaad" method of simply guessing the answer, which, unsurprisingly, did not work.

unnormalised: A leaked question paper shows terrifying problems involving the rate of change of samosa sales at a local chai stall during monsoon season (a truly relatable nightmare scenario). The rumor is that Dr. Iyer is now considering using "chai breaks" every 15 mins to try and keep students from going absolutely mad during the course. It may also involve the integration (pun intended) of memes into the lecture material, with hopes that laughing at calculus concepts is better than crying over them.
